result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph W Rott Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Cash bond of $100 is applied to financial obligation owed - BALANCE IS $786

Financial obligation ($786) is converted to a Civil Judgment
.

The defendant has 60 days to report (12-13-15) but if the defendant has no police contact between now and the report date, the 90-day sentence will be Vacated and the sentence will be Time Served.  The defendant is to send a note to the Court about having no police contact before the report date and the Court will Vacate the sentence

Pay Court costs/fees - all converted to a Civil Judgment
.

TIME SERVED
Concurrent with: Concurrent with Ct 2 of this case
.
